method.text: Preheat oven to 140°C. Grease and line a Swiss roll tin with a 23 x 33 cm (9 x 13in) sheet of parchment paper.
In a clean bowl, whisk the egg whites until stiff. Whisk in the vanilla extract, cornflour and vinegar.
Slowly whisk in the sugar, a little at a time, until mixture is glossy and stiff. Spread into the prepared Swiss roll tin. Sprinkle the nuts over the top.
Bake for about 40 min. Remove the meringue from the oven. Cover with cling film or foil. Leave to cool.
Puree the strawberies in a food processor or blender until thick. Set aside.
In a clean bowl, lightly whisk the cream. Fold in the yogurt.

Turn the meringue out onto a sheet of clean greaseproof paper. Using a palette knife, spread the cream mixture on top. Drizzle the strawberry puree onto the cream, setting aside any puree that remains.
Roll up the roulade to form a Swiss roll. Place in the freezer or fridge for 1 hour.
Serve in slices. Use any remaining puree as a sauce.
